layer.name: Responsibility
layer.definition: If it's in your life, it's yours to address.

questions.text: My spiritual state is primarily the result of ...

answers.4: my choices, though external factors still have influence
answers.5: my choices — circumstances explain, they don't define
answers.2: factors that have shaped me in ways I can't easily change
answers.3: both external forces and my choices — it's complicated
answers.1: circumstances, upbringing, or spiritual attacks beyond my control

questions.principle: Own your sin; don't externalize blame

answers.4: I choose to give in, though some temptations are harder than others
answers.5: I choose to give in — the temptation doesn't make the choice
answers.2: certain influences make it nearly impossible to resist
answers.3: what I get from it feels worth it in the moment

questions.text: Areas of spiritual compromise in my life are ...

answers.4: mine to address, though I often drag my feet
answers.2: struggles I'll deal with when God gives me the strength
answers.3: on my list, but I'm waiting for the right season to tackle them
answers.1: things I'm waiting on God to deliver me from

questions.text: When I'm in a spiritually dry or difficult season, how I respond is ...

answers.4: my choice, though I don't always respond well
answers.5: my choice — the season doesn't dictate my response
answers.2: shaped by the difficulty — hard seasons make for hard choices
answers.3: partly my choice, partly driven by circumstances
answers.1: understandable given what I'm going through

questions.text: Ongoing sin or spiritual weakness in my life is ...

answers.4: something I am changing, while holding on to some
answers.3: something I regret but have to live with
answers.1: just how I am — some things don't change

remediation.advice: Taking responsibility for holiness means admitting: 'My spiritual state is largely my doing.' This isn't about guilt — it's about agency. If you caused it, you can change it. Stop waiting for deliverance and start cooperating with the sanctification process.

scripture.text: Put to death, therefore, whatever belongs to your earthly nature.
